p:
RRV disease is notifiable to public health authorities in Australia and is the most common arboviral disease in Australia. There has been a mean of 4600 (range 1451–9554) reported cases per year (2000–2015), equating to a mean national incidence of 21.3 (range 7.4–40.2) per 100,000 per annum in the same period (data available via http://www9.health.gov.au/cda/source/rpt_4.cfm). Disease typically occurs in adults between 25 and 39 years old, with no clear predominance in males or females. Symptomatic infections are rare in children.
1
